column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////The restaurant has a garage behind it you can either park for free or valet park in. You can also meter park on the street. Inside there's two bars you can sit at
column3: and booths. My friends and I ordered takoyaki for an appetizer
column4: jinya no. 1 and chasu rice bowl. It was very flavorful. I had the chasu rice bowl because ramen usually doesn't fill me up. It comes in two sizes. They give you a lot of meat which I liked but the sauce was a bit too salty. I had my glass of water refilled 4x because I kept drinking it all. The waitress was very nice and came often. They also allowed us to split checks here.
